wikipedia_page.main: Francis George Broadbent (1909, Fulham, London – 13 January 1983, Wandsworth, London) was a 20th-century English architect known for his work in designing churches and schools for the Roman Catholic Church.

response: * Frank Broadbent (1909–1983), architect, designed churches and schools for the Roman Catholic Church,  lived at 71 Christchurch Road, East Sheen.  Dictionary of Scottish Architects, Francis George Broadbent retrieved 19 January 2018
